fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Nicola Thorp, sent home for not wearing high heels, did not bring legal proceedings against a company, as an article suggested. Rather, she started a parliamentary e-petition calling for an end to dress codes that make such footwear compulsory (Do women have to wear bras at work?, 12 November, page 2, G2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Tommy Robinson not granted US visa in time for Washington visit In the balance: scientists vote on first change to kilogram in a century Half of young people facing homelessness denied help – report
